tool.name: Show-Tiling

param.name: delta
param.label: Output from either nucmer or promer

param.name: path
param.label: Tiling path
param.help: Describe the tiling path by printing the tab-delimited alignment region coordinates to stdout

param.name: circular
param.label: Assume circular
param.help: Assume the reference sequences are circular, and allow tiled contigs to span the origin

param.name: gap
param.label: Set maximum gap between clustered alignments
param.help: A value of -1 will reprensent infinity. nucmer default=1000 promer default=-1

param.name: identity
param.label: Set minimum percent identity to tile

param.name: length
param.label: Set minimum length contig to report
param.help: A value of -1 will reprensent infinity

param.name: pseudo_yes_no
param.label: Output a pseudo molecule of the query contigs?

param.name: repetitive
param.label: Repetitive contigs
param.help: Deal with repetitive contigs by randomly placing them in one of their copy locations

param.name: tigr_yes_no
param.label: Output a TIGR style contig list of each query sequence that sufficiently matches the reference

param.name: unusable_yes_no
param.label: Output the tab-delimited alignment region coordinates of the unusable contigs

param.name: min_coverage
param.label: Set minimum contig coverage to tile
param.help: nucmer default = 95.0 (sum of individual alignments(, promer default = 50.0 (extent of syntenic region)

param.name: coverage_diff
param.label: Set minimum contig coverage difference
param.help: i.e. the difference needed to determine one alignment is 'better' than another alignment. nucmer default = 10.0 (sum of individual alignments) promer default = 30.0 (extent of syntenic region)

param.name: xml
param.label: XML
param.help: Describe the tiling path by printing the XML contig linking information to stdout

tool.help: This program attempts to construct a tiling path out of the query contigs as mapped to the reference sequences. Given the delta alignment information of a few long reference sequences and many small query contigs, show-tiling will determine the best location on a reference for each contig. Note that each contig may only be tiled once, so repetitive regions may cause this program some difficulty. This program is useful for aiding in the scaffolding and closure of an unfinished set of contigs, if a suitable, high similarity, reference genome is available. Or, if using promer, show-tiling will help in the identification of syntenic regions and their contig's mapping the the references.
